data.text:
A truly incredible story! ‚¨áÔ∏è In a brief summary: Will Adolphy From having a troubled childhood & being kicked out of school to turning his life around becoming a psychotherapist & counsellor now helping kids all around the country not make the same mistakes he did. Someone who understands the young people of today and uses his past experiences and the lessons he learnt from them to do good. The stories we love to share üôåüèº More about will - willadolphy.com Part 1 is here üî•

Can't believe it, we are already in Episode 9 of the series #20ImpactfulPeople üíõ‚ú® Introducing, Desy Bachir, one of the most prominent figures in the world of marketing. However, this figure is certainly not free from stigma ‚Äî especially about being 40 years old. Turning 40 is a new milestone, but Desy isn't letting it stop her from pursuing her goals. She feels that she still has so many things she can achieve and be grateful for! Let's see the full story at https://lnkd.in/gFbZH5yu ‚ú® #PersonalGrowthID #ImpactTheWorld #BreakingStigma #MentalHealth #Aging #Psychology

Why You Feel Trapped in Behaviors You Can't Explain In this revealing video, Katie Kaahanui and Evan Leong discuss the roots of inexplicable behaviors and feelings of being trapped. Katie explains how deep-seated trauma, often stemming from unmet needs in our formative years, can manifest in adulthood as behaviors we can't understand. Evan adds that trauma is not just about what happens to us, but what happens inside us as a result. This episode sheds light on the importance of connecting with and healing these inner wounds to regain control over our actions and lives. Discover how understanding your inner child's unmet needs can lead to profound personal transformation. #GGRClips #GreaterGoodRadio #ConnectLearnHealGrow #InspirationalInterviews #Hawaii #Relationships #PositiveImpact #AlohaSpirit #KatieKaahanui #EvanLeong #TraumaHealing #InnerChild #BehavioralHealth #MentalHealthAwareness #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth Evan Leong Katie Kaahanui Waikiki Business Improvement District Chamber of Commerce Hawaii WATCH the FULL VIDEO üëâ https://lnkd.in/gg82NVai

Advertising is a stressful business and whenever I've needed some mental clarity I would go for a run. Exercise takes your mind to a different place and more often than not I would end a run with either an idea or at least a better perspective on a problem. What I love about Joe Wicks is how he is raising awareness of the link between mental and physical health and also reducing the barriers to getting started. As the saying goes 'the heaviest weight in the gym is the front door'. You don't need to go for a run to get the benefits of exercise. Increasingly I have enjoying walking and trying out walking meetings. It is amazing how a change of scene can change your mood and your outlook on a problem. And how the tone of a meeting changes when you are both walking vs stuck in a meeting room.

"If we step back to look at what each partner is actually seeking, it is generally validation, a deeper understanding of what they are thinking, feeling, and why." üíò This is an excerpt from Octave's article (by clinician Cathryn Waters) on emotional connection with your partner. üîé Connection means paying attention. üíì Paying attention gives meaning to life, work, and relationships. ‚û° When you take time to understand what someone is seeking, it is usually validation and a deeper exploration of the topic at hand. ‚ù£ When it comes to writing, imagining what your audience is thinking, feeling, and why, is one way to foster connection. üí° The best kind of articles and content: inform, guide, and support the reader. ‚û° They make you consider new ideas from old ways of being, or consider old ideas in a new way. ‚û° They incorporate up-to-date or fascinating research to support claims. ‚û° They add value to your life. ‚úí As a clinical nurse writer specializing in many things, including LGBTQIA+ health, telehealth, pediatrics, nutrition, holistic health, and mental health; I love writing content that connects. üíù Thanks for this reminder on what it all really boils down to (in relationships, work, and life) this Valentine's Day: connection. #holistichealth #mentalhealth #connection #copywriting #clinicalwriting #wellness #telehealth #editor #nursewriter

Humorous State of Mind: Procession Life with Laughter! Join us in this uproarious journey as we delve into the art of processing life through laughter. In this episode, we explore the transformative power of humor in navigating the twists and turns of our daily existence. From unexpected challenges to heartwarming triumphs, we unravel the therapeutic benefits of laughter in enhancing resilience, fostering connections, and embracing the beauty of imperfection. Through captivating anecdotes, expert insights, and side-splitting moments, discover how humor becomes a guiding light, making even the most complex facets of life a little brighter. So, buckle up for a rollercoaster of emotions, sprinkled with humor, as we learn to find joy in the ordinary and turn life‚Äôs hurdles into hilarious anecdotes. Get ready to laugh, reflect, and embrace the lighter side of the human experience! Buckle Up! You won‚Äôt want to skip this @BrainLikeMind discussion Full episode here: https://lnkd.in/g8rAH-HQ #Daled33 #comedy #LMFT #SEP #mentalhealth #composercolin #LASoundStudio #mentalhealthmatters #mentalhealthissues #mentalheathcounseling #mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealthadvocate #mentalhealthrecovery #mentalhealthisimportant #mentalhealthwarrior #dowhatyoulove #psychology #selfcare #selfimprovement #equanimity #community #curiosity #health #healthylifestyle

With our hyper focus on standards, curriculum and assessments, there is a resulting disconnection of relationships that happens in schools. In this episode, Becca Silver explores how to combat that by highlighting our addiction to being right (trust me, it relates) and how it impacts our relationships and connections. 1Ô∏è‚É£ The Addiction to Being Right: Discover why our brains are naturally wired to judge and seek the comfort of being right. Becca discusses the roots of this addiction and its impact on our daily interactions. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Neurological Rewards: Uncover the brain's response to being right ‚Äì the release of reward chemicals like adrenaline and dopamine. Learn how this can lead to the perception of others as wrong and the resulting disconnect. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Choose Connection: Becca challenges us to shift our mindset from being right to fostering genuine connections with others. Examine the power of compassion and the positive impact it can have on building meaningful relationships. Join Becca as she encourages us to reflect on our own tendencies and provides strategies to help us shift our mindset from a need to be right to a commitment to genuine connection. This is something all human beings deal with. Listen to Ep. 59 here: https://buff.ly/405JAdj #edupodcast #empowered #chooseconnection

üéôüîîüëãIn this episode of Ask the Therapist, im joined by Dr Tim van Wanrooij, a Chartered Counselling Psychologist based in Dublin. To discuss the importance of understanding the nuances of relationships and how to navigate intense emotions. When couples are in conflict, it is often not about the practicalities of life but rather about deeper issues that have been coming up time and time again. Dr. Tim explains that "When couples are in conflict, it is often not about the practicalities of life, but rather about deeper issues that have been coming up time and time again." He also discusses why couples often get stuck in the same arguments and how emotion-focused therapy can help people to identify and express underlying emotions. Spotify Link: https://lnkd.in/dzQBeRcA #emotionallyfocusedtherapy #relationshipadvice #relationshiptherapist
